18.1.5. Saturation horizons
•  Deep, cold ocean waters are naturally under saturated
with carbonate ions causing the shells of most calcifying
organisms to dissolve.
•  Surface waters are over saturated with carbonate ions
and do not readily dissolve shells of calcifying organisms.
•  The saturation horizon is the level below which calcium
carbonate minerals undergo dissolution.
